header.title: ESOTERIC EXTENSION OF TAROT TO DEVELOP SUPERSENSORY POWERS

central_thesis: This work, presented as a transcription of Ann Davies' lectures, posits that clairsentience, an intuitive sense of 'touch' on the inner planes, is a fundamental supersensory power that can be developed and extended through the esoteric study of Tarot, particularly Key 9, the Hermit, to achieve a conscious identity with the Higher Self and aid in spiritual evolution.

structure_content.chapter_title: LESSON 29: Transcriptions from Ann Davies' Class Lectures
structure_content.summary: The lesson introduces clairsentience as a fundamental supersensory power, akin to an inner sense of touch, which operates on the inner planes and involves the transmission and reception of thoughts and emotions through a shared psychic substance. The author explains her own extreme clairsentience, describing it as a fluidic awareness of emotional content that can be both a gift and a burden. The text emphasizes that this faculty is reciprocal and requires great strength to manage, particularly for those who act as channels. It discusses the potential for both positive (love, peace) and negative (enmity, hatred) transmissions, drawing parallels to the esoteric teachings and the development of the Higher Self. The practical application involves using Tarot Key 9 (The Hermit) to cultivate conscious identity with the Self, strengthening the practitioner against negative psychic influences and fostering a flow of positive spiritual energy.

key_concepts.definition: An esoteric supersensory power described as an inner sense of 'touch' that operates on the inner planes. It involves the perception of vibrations, emotions, and thoughts transmitted through a shared psychic substance. The author describes it as being aware of the flow of substance with its emotional content, akin to feeling water flow through one's entire being.

Non-physical dimensions or levels of consciousness where psychic and spiritual activities occur. In this context, touch, thought, and emotion are transmitted and received irrespective of physical distance.
The collective consciousness or psychic substance that permeates all of existence, through which thoughts and emotions are transmitted and received, allowing for clairsentient connection.

The spiritual, divine aspect of an individual, or the ultimate unified consciousness. The text emphasizes developing conscious identity with this Self, particularly through the practice related to Tarot Key 9, as a means of gaining strength and guidance.

The principle that emotions and thoughts transmitted through clairsentience are not one-way. If one can send emotions, one can also receive them, making the practitioner open to both positive and negative psychic influences.

The reception of negative emotions or energies from others, which can manifest as envy, jealousy, or a desire to harm. This is described as a torrent of psychic force, often unconscious on the part of the sender, that a clairsentient individual can perceive and be affected by.

A spiritual journey or process of evolution towards re-union with the divine or the Higher Self. The text suggests that through spiritual practice, one travels this path rather than 'going around in circles'.

A specific Tarot card used as a practical tool for developing conscious identity with the Self. The technique involves visualizing a yellow-green light representing unity and love, and the Hermit's lantern light permeating the practitioner, fostering compassion, guidance, and inner strength.

practical_system.description: The core practical system revolves around the development and conscious use of clairsentience, framed as an inner sense of touch. The method involves understanding that psychic substance permeates all things and that thoughts and emotions are constantly transmitted and received. The author's personal experience as an extreme clairsentient serves as a model and a warning about the dual nature of this faculty (gift and burden). The primary operative technique presented is the esoteric application of Tarot Key 9, The Hermit. This involves visualization and meditative immersion to achieve conscious identity with the 'One Self' or Higher Self. This union is presented as the source of strength, guidance, and protection against negative psychic influences. The practice aims to cultivate a positive psychic flow and enable the practitioner to act as a beneficial conduit for spiritual energies.
rituals: Visualization of yellow-green light (unity, love) permeating being.
Meditative immersion with the symbolism of the Hermit's lantern (compassion, guidance).
Achieving conscious identity with the Self through focused practice.
Affirmation: 'I am one with the One and One alone...'

relevant_quotes.text: Clairsentience is just as definitely a sense of touch, if not more so but because we do not realize this we ascribe the feeling to indefinite things.

To give you some idea of what this sensation is I ask you to imagine that instead of turning on the faucet and feeling it on your hand, you feel the stream of water not just on your body but going through your heart or your brain, passing into and through every atom of your being in the same way.

The reason that I can reach out in the subconscious level and touch you and therefore bring out the things you need to hear is because of this sensitivity, but this is not a one-way street. All emotion is reciprocal, therefore, I am open to thoughts and emotions from outside, some of which are beautiful and some of which are more painful than I could begin to describe.

The vehicle of someone whose destiny is, for whatever reason, to be a channel, takes on a heavy burden in the use of the clairsentient faculty as a primary necessity for channeling and must have great strength not to crumble under it.

I am always clairsentient when lecturing and writing because no matter what my personal life is, when I enter into the Temple to teach either verbally or through the written word my personality is put aside. I instantly become aware of the inflow of this force, this love--the radiations from the lantern in the hands of the Hermit, flowing through me to you.
This is the clairsentient awareness of the love that is the heart of the universe.
That is the love side I have told you. There is another side. There are times that one feels enmity or hatred rushing in.
When a person is clairsentient, he picks that up.
This substance is a healing thing, in a physical way as well as in spiritual and emotional ways.

We must understand the universe in which we live, and our consciousness, and the powers of our consciousness, so that we can use them as we are meant to use them and thereby help the rest of humanity.
Think of the Hermit as being that One Identity... as being the hand that fashions the universe and you, and that you, in turn, are the hand of God.
The light of his lantern is pouring into and permeating you with compassion and guidance. See it as a fluid, a golden fluid, pouring all through you from the six-rayed star.

AFFIRMATION: I am one with the One and One alone. The conflicts, hurts and sorrows that I have experienced in the past are but the shadow play of ignorance. As I climb ever nearer to the height upon which the Hermit stands, I become ever more conscious of my True Identity--my True Self.

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is highly relevant to students of modern esoteric Tarot and the development of psychic abilities. It bridges the gap between theoretical occultism and practical application, offering a specific method for cultivating clairsentience. Its emphasis on the reciprocal nature of psychic exchange and the management of emotional inflow/outflow is crucial for any practitioner engaging with inter-personal psychic phenomena. The connection to the Hermit archetype provides a concrete symbolic anchor for the practice.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary audience is students and practitioners of Tarot and esoteric disciplines who are seeking to develop or enhance their supersensory faculties, particularly clairsentience. It is also relevant for those interested in channeling, psychic sensitivity, and the practical application of Tarot symbolism in personal spiritual development, as well as individuals seeking to understand and manage psychic influences and attacks.
